1251892955864084481.text: A business with a 10% reduction in revenue for one month, who had  no intention to lay off employees, must not be placed into the same category as an owner-operated daycare center with no cash flow and no way to survive.

1251892954400243714.text: It is unacceptable that the @USTreasury and the @SBAgov guidelines had no revenue loss requirements, and only required an attestation that a business was “negatively impacted” by #COVID19.

1251877807623462912.text: All Members of Congress must flag this issue to the @USTreasury and it needs to be fixed immediately. (9/9)

1251877806654586889.text: Businesses that depend on foot traffic and direct in-person contact, like small restaurants, are the businesses that are now insolvent because of this pandemic, and these companies account for nearly 50% of our nation’s workforce. (8/9)

1251877805526319106.text: The @USTreasury must be establish clear requirements that banks prioritize insolvent coffee shop owners over solvent hedge fund owners. (7/9)

1251877804523892740.text: Many larger banks around the country simply prioritized their larger customers with significant banking relationships, taking money away from the small coffee shop owner. This cannot and will not stand. Our small businesses need our help and they need it now. (6/9)

1251877803559174146.text: This has occurred because of ambiguous and insufficient guard rails being established by the @USTreasury with regards to the PPP. (5/9)

1251877802577723396.text: This is money that is literally being taken away from the very small businesses that Congress intended to help, small businesses who have been forced to lay off workers due to insufficient cash flow. (4/9)

1251877801499799553.text: Banks were also receiving applications from businesses that are not small, do not rely on foot traffic and are not insolvent, like hedge funds and brokerage businesses, who in some cases received as much as $10M in forgivable loans. (3/9)

1251877800375656450.text: Round 1 of the PPP missed its target. Banks were receiving applications not just from mom-and-pop small businesses that depend on foot traffic and are barely solvent, like small restaurants, hardware stores and plumbers, whom the PPP was specifically designed to help. (2/9)

1251877797523488769.text: Two things must happen immediately. First, Congress must immediately pass a clean supplement to the #PaycheckProtectionProgram (PPP) by a minimum of $250B. Second, the @USTreasury must immediately fix the PPP to benefit Main Street, not Wall Street. (1/9)

976641652390531072.text: With the House's vote, both chambers have now showed that #RightToTry can pass with bipartisan support. I stand with my colleagues @RepAndyBiggsAZ & @SenRonJohnson in demanding that Right to Try – in any form – make it to the president’s desk to be signed into law.

976641608572694534.text: For those patients caught between the traditional drug approval delays, a clinical trial process for which they do not qualify & limited time, this #RightToTry simply establishes the freedom for patients to try therapies in situations where the benefits far outweigh the risks.

976641575152422913.text: After years of debate, discussion & negotiation, the House  showed what has always been clear to me & those I represent: #RightToTry is a common sense, bipartisan measure that gives patients & families facing an unimaginable situation the opportunity to fight for their lives.
